Content:
# Elementary: HTML Templating in Pure Swift

**A modern and efficient HTML rendering library - inspired by SwiftUI, built for the web.**

[![](https://img.shields.io/endpoint?url=https%3A%2F%2Fswiftpackageindex.com%2Fapi%2Fpackages%2Fsliemeobn%2Felementary%2Fbadge%3Ftype%3Dswift-versions)](https://swiftpackageindex.com/sliemeobn/elementary) [![](https://img.shields.io/endpoint?url=https%3A%2F%2Fswiftpackageindex.com%2Fapi%2Fpackages%2Fsliemeobn%2Felementary%2Fbadge%3Ftype%3Dplatforms)](https://swiftpackageindex.com/sliemeobn/elementary)

[Examples](#play-with-it) | [Motivation](#motivation-and-other-packages) | [Discussion](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary/discussions)
Translation:
# Elementary: HTML Templating in Pure Swift

**A modern and efficient HTML rendering library - inspired by SwiftUI, built for the web.**

[![](https://img.shields.io/endpoint?url=https%3A%2F%2Fswiftpackageindex.com%2Fapi%2Fpackages%2Fsliemeobn%2Felementary%2Fbadge%3Ftype%3Dswift-versions)](https://swiftpackageindex.com/sliemeobn/elementary) [![](https://img.shields.io/endpoint?url=https%3A%2F%2Fswiftpackageindex.com%2Fapi%2Fpackages%2Fsliemeobn%2Felementary%2Fbadge%3Ftype%3Dplatforms)](https://swiftpackageindex.com/sliemeobn/elementary)

[Examples](#play-with-it) | [Motivation](#motivation-and-other-packages) | [Discussion](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary/discussions)

RowTranslations.originContent: # Elementary: HTML Templating in Pure Swift
RowTranslations.translatedContent: # Elementary: HTML Templating in Pure Swift

RowTranslations.originContent: **A modern and efficient HTML rendering library - inspired by SwiftUI, built for the web.**
RowTranslations.translatedContent: **A modern and efficient HTML rendering library - inspired by SwiftUI, built for the web.**

Content:
## Use it

Add the dependency to `Package.swift`
Translation:
## Úsalo

Agrega la dependencia a `Package.swift`

Content:
```swift
.package(url: "https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary.git", from: "0.3.2")
.product(name: "Elementary", package: "elementary")
```
Translation:
```swift
.package(url: "https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary.git", from: "0.3.2")
.product(name: "Elementary", package: "elementary")
```

Content: Integration with [Hummingbird](https://github.com/hummingbird-community/hummingbird-elementary)
Translation: Integración con [Hummingbird](https://github.com/hummingbird-community/hummingbird-elementary)

Content:
```swift
.package(url: "https://github.com/hummingbird-community/hummingbird-elementary.git", from: "0.3.0")
.product(name: "HummingbirdElementary", package: "hummingbird-elementary")
```
Translation:
```swift
.package(url: "https://github.com/hummingbird-community/hummingbird-elementary.git", from: "0.3.0")
.product(name: "HummingbirdElementary", package: "hummingbird-elementary")
```

Content: Integration with [Vapor](https://github.com/vapor-community/vapor-elementary)
Translation: Integración con [Vapor](https://github.com/vapor-community/vapor-elementary)

Content:
```swift
.package(url: "https://github.com/vapor-community/vapor-elementary.git", from: "0.1.0")
.product(name: "VaporElementary", package: "vapor-elementary")
```
Translation:
```swift
.package(url: "https://github.com/vapor-community/vapor-elementary.git", from: "0.1.0")
.product(name: "VaporElementary", package: "vapor-elementary")
```

Content:
## Play with it

Check out the [Hummingbird + Tailwind example app](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary/tree/main/Examples/HummingbirdDemo).

For a demo of [ElementaryHTMX](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx), see this [Hummingbird + HTMX Demo](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx/tree/main/Examples/HummingbirdDemo).

For a Vapor example, see the [Vapor + HTMX Demo](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx/tree/main/Examples/VaporDemo).

## Lightweight and fast

Elementary renders straight to text, optimized for serving generated HTML from a [Hummingbird](https://github.com/hummingbird-project/hummingbird) or [Vapor](https://vapor.codes/) server app.

Any type conforming to `HTML` can be rendered individually, ideal for testing or for sending fragments with [htmx](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx).

The default rendering mechanism produces chunks of HTML for efficient response streaming, so the browser can start loading a page while the server is still producing the rest of it. Swift concurrency is used to handle back pressure, so you your memory footprint stays low even for large pages.
Translation:
## Juega con ello

Consulta la [aplicación de ejemplo Hummingbird + Tailwind](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary/tree/main/Examples/HummingbirdDemo).

Para una demostración de [ElementaryHTMX](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx), mira esta [demostración Hummingbird + HTMX](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx/tree/main/Examples/HummingbirdDemo).

Para un ejemplo con Vapor, consulta la [demostración Vapor + HTMX](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx/tree/main/Examples/VaporDemo).

## Ligero y rápido

Elementary renderiza directamente a texto, optimizado para servir HTML generado desde una aplicación servidor [Hummingbird](https://github.com/hummingbird-project/hummingbird) o [Vapor](https://vapor.codes/).

Cualquier tipo que conforme a `HTML` puede renderizarse individualmente, ideal para pruebas o para enviar fragmentos con [htmx](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx).

El mecanismo de renderizado por defecto produce fragmentos de HTML para una transmisión eficiente de la respuesta, de modo que el navegador puede comenzar a cargar una página mientras el servidor sigue produciendo el resto. Se usa la concurrencia de Swift para manejar la presión de retorno, por lo que tu uso de memoria se mantiene bajo incluso para páginas grandes.

RowTranslations.originContent: For a demo of [ElementaryHTMX](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx), see this [Hummingbird + HTMX Demo](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx/tree/main/Examples/HummingbirdDemo).
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Para una demostración de [ElementaryHTMX](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx), mira esta [demostración Hummingbird + HTMX](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx/tree/main/Examples/HummingbirdDemo).

RowTranslations.originContent: For a Vapor example, see the [Vapor + HTMX Demo](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx/tree/main/Examples/VaporDemo).
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Para un ejemplo con Vapor, consulta la [demostración Vapor + HTMX](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx/tree/main/Examples/VaporDemo).

RowTranslations.translatedContent: Cualquier tipo que conforme a `HTML` puede renderizarse individualmente, ideal para pruebas o para enviar fragmentos con [htmx](https://github.com/sliemeobn/elementary-htmx).

RowTranslations.originContent: The default rendering mechanism produces chunks of HTML for efficient response streaming, so the browser can start loading a page while the server is still producing the rest of it. Swift concurrency is used to handle back pressure, so you your memory footprint stays low even for large pages.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: El mecanismo de renderizado por defecto produce fragmentos de HTML para una transmisión eficiente de la respuesta, de modo que el navegador puede comenzar a cargar una página mientras el servidor sigue produciendo el resto. Se usa la concurrencia de Swift para manejar la presión de retorno, por lo que tu uso de memoria se mantiene bajo incluso para páginas grandes.

Content:
Elementary has zero dependencies (not even Foundation) and does not use runtime reflection or existential containers (there is not a single `any` in the code base).

By design, it does not come with a layout engine, reactive state tracking, or built-in CSS styling: it just renders HTML.

## Clean and composable

Structure your HTML with a SwiftUI-inspired composition API.
Translation:
Elementary no tiene dependencias (ni siquiera Foundation) y no utiliza reflexión en tiempo de ejecución ni contenedores existenciales (no hay ni un solo `any` en la base de código).

Por diseño, no incluye un motor de diseño, seguimiento reactivo del estado ni estilos CSS incorporados: simplemente renderiza HTML.

## Limpio y componible

Estructura tu HTML con una API de composición inspirada en SwiftUI.

RowTranslations.translatedContent: Elementary no tiene dependencias (ni siquiera Foundation) y no utiliza reflexión en tiempo de ejecución ni contenedores existenciales (no hay ni un solo `any` en la base de código).

RowTranslations.originContent: Elementary has zero dependencies (not even Foundation) and does not use runtime reflection or existential containers (there is not a single `any` in the code base).

RowTranslations.translatedContent: Por diseño, no incluye un motor de diseño, seguimiento reactivo del estado ni estilos CSS incorporados: simplemente renderiza HTML.

RowTranslations.originContent: By design, it does not come with a layout engine, reactive state tracking, or built-in CSS styling: it just renders HTML.

RowTranslations.translatedContent: Estructura tu HTML con una API de composición inspirada en SwiftUI.

RowTranslations.originContent: Structure your HTML with a SwiftUI-inspired composition API.

Content:
## First class attribute handling

Elementary utilizes Swift's powerful generics to provide an attribute system that knows what goes where. Every element knows which Tag it is for.

As in HTML, attributes go right after the "opening tag".
Translation:
## Manejo de atributos de primera clase

Elementary utiliza los potentes genéricos de Swift para proporcionar un sistema de atributos que sabe qué va dónde. Cada elemento sabe para qué etiqueta es.

Como en HTML, los atributos van justo después de la "etiqueta de apertura".

RowTranslations.translatedContent: ## Manejo de atributos de primera clase

RowTranslations.originContent: Elementary utilizes Swift's powerful generics to provide an attribute system that knows what goes where. Every element knows which Tag it is for.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Elementary utiliza los potentes genéricos de Swift para proporcionar un sistema de atributos que sabe qué va dónde. Cada elemento sabe para qué etiqueta es.

RowTranslations.originContent: As in HTML, attributes go right after the "opening tag".
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Como en HTML, los atributos van justo después de la "etiqueta de apertura".

RowTranslations.originContent: // staying close to HTML syntax really helps
RowTranslations.translatedContent: // staying close to HTML syntax really helps

Content: Attributes can also be altered by using the modifier syntax, this allows for easy handling of conditional attributes.
Translation: Los atributos también pueden modificarse utilizando la sintaxis de modificador, lo que permite un manejo sencillo de atributos condicionales.

RowTranslations.translatedContent: Los atributos también pueden modificarse utilizando la sintaxis de modificador, lo que permite un manejo sencillo de atributos condicionales.

RowTranslations.originContent: Attributes can also be altered by using the modifier syntax, this allows for easy handling of conditional attributes.

Content: By exposing the tag type of `content`, attributes will fall through and be applied correctly.
Translation: Al exponer el tipo de etiqueta de `content`, los atributos se filtrarán y aplicarán correctamente.

RowTranslations.translatedContent: Al exponer el tipo de etiqueta de `content`, los atributos se filtrarán y aplicarán correctamente.

RowTranslations.originContent: By exposing the tag type of `content`, attributes will fall through and be applied correctly.
// by exposing the HTMLTag type information...
RowTranslations.translatedContent: // by exposing the HTMLTag type information...

RowTranslations.originContent: // ... Button will know it really is an <input> element ...
RowTranslations.translatedContent: // ... Button will know it really is an <input> element ...

Content:
As a sensible default, _class_ and _style_ attributes are merged (with a blank space or semicolon respectively). All other attributes are overwritten by default.

## Seamless async support

Elementary supports Swift Concurrency in HTML content. Simply `await` something inside your HTML, while the first bytes are already flying towards the browser.
Translation:
Como valor predeterminado sensato, los atributos _class_ y _style_ se combinan (con un espacio en blanco o punto y coma respectivamente). Todos los demás atributos se sobrescriben por defecto.

## Soporte asincrónico sin interrupciones

Elementary soporta Swift Concurrency en contenido HTML. Simplemente `await` algo dentro de tu HTML, mientras los primeros bytes ya están en camino hacia el navegador.

RowTranslations.originContent: As a sensible default, _class_ and _style_ attributes are merged (with a blank space or semicolon respectively). All other attributes are overwritten by default.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Como valor predeterminado sensato, los atributos _class_ y _style_ se combinan (con un espacio en blanco o punto y coma respectivamente). Todos los demás atributos se sobrescriben por defecto.

RowTranslations.originContent: Elementary supports Swift Concurrency in HTML content. Simply `await` something inside your HTML, while the first bytes are already flying towards the browser.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Elementary soporta Swift Concurrency en contenido HTML. Simplemente `await` algo dentro de tu HTML, mientras los primeros bytes ya están en camino hacia el navegador.

Content: By using the `AsyncForEach` element, any `AsyncSequence` can be efficiently rendered straight to HTML.
Translation: Al usar el elemento `AsyncForEach`, cualquier `AsyncSequence` puede renderizarse eficientemente directamente en HTML.

RowTranslations.originContent: By using the `AsyncForEach` element, any `AsyncSequence` can be efficiently rendered straight to HTML.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Al usar el elemento `AsyncForEach`, cualquier `AsyncSequence` puede renderizarse eficientemente directamente en HTML.

RowTranslations.originContent: // the full result never needs to be stored in memory...
RowTranslations.translatedContent: // the full result never needs to be stored in memory...

Content:
## Enviroment values

Elementary utilizes `TaskLocal`s to provide a light-weight environment system.
Translation:
## Valores de entorno

Elementary utiliza `TaskLocal`s para proporcionar un sistema de entorno liviano.

RowTranslations.originContent: Elementary utilizes `TaskLocal`s to provide a light-weight environment system.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: Elementary utiliza `TaskLocal`s para proporcionar un sistema de entorno liviano.

RowTranslations.translatedContent: // ... and provided in a familiar way

Content:
### 🚧 Work in progress 🚧

The list of built-in attributes is far from complete, but adding them is really simple (and can be done in external packages as well).

Feel free to open a PR with additional attributes that are missing from the model.

## Motivation and other packages

[Plot](https://github.com/JohnSundell/Plot), [HTMLKit](https://github.com/vapor-community/HTMLKit), and [Swim](https://github.com/robb/Swim) are all excellent packages for doing a similar thing.

My main motivation for Elementary was to create an experience like these ([Swift Forums post](https://forums.swift.org/t/elementary-a-modern-and-efficient-html-rendering-library-inspired-by-swiftui-built-for-the-web/72647) for more context), but

- stay true to HTML tag names and conventions (including the choice of lowercase types)
- avoid allocating an intermedate structure and go straight to streaming HTML
- using generics to stay away from allocating a ton of lists of existential `any`s
- have a list of attributes go before the content block
- provide _attribute fallthrough_ and merging
- zero dependencies on other packages

[Tokamak](https://github.com/TokamakUI/Tokamak) is an awesome project and very inspiring. It can produce HTML, but it's main focus is on a very different beast. Check it out!

[swift-html](https://github.com/pointfreeco/swift-html) and [swift-dom](https://github.com/tayloraswift/swift-dom) will produce HTML nicely, but they use a different syntax for composing HTML elements.

## Future directions

- Experiment with embedded swift for wasm and bolt a lean state tracking/reconciler for reactive DOM manipulation on top
Translation:
### 🚧 Trabajo en progreso 🚧

La lista de atributos incorporados está lejos de estar completa, pero agregarlos es realmente simple (y también se puede hacer en paquetes externos).

Siéntete libre de abrir un PR con atributos adicionales que falten en el modelo.

## Motivación y otros paquetes

[Plot](https://github.com/JohnSundell/Plot), [HTMLKit](https://github.com/vapor-community/HTMLKit) y [Swim](https://github.com/robb/Swim) son todos paquetes excelentes para hacer algo similar.

Mi principal motivación para Elementary fue crear una experiencia como estas ([publicación en Swift Forums](https://forums.swift.org/t/elementary-a-modern-and-efficient-html-rendering-library-inspired-by-swiftui-built-for-the-web/72647) para más contexto), pero

- mantenernos fieles a los nombres y convenciones de etiquetas HTML (incluida la elección de tipos en minúsculas)
- evitar asignar una estructura intermedia e ir directamente a transmitir HTML
- usar genéricos para evitar asignar muchas listas de `any`s existenciales
- tener una lista de atributos antes del bloque de contenido
- proporcionar _atributo paso a través_ y fusión
- cero dependencias de otros paquetes

[Tokamak](https://github.com/TokamakUI/Tokamak) es un proyecto impresionante y muy inspirador. Puede producir HTML, pero su enfoque principal es en una bestia muy diferente. ¡Échale un vistazo!

[swift-html](https://github.com/pointfreeco/swift-html) y [swift-dom](https://github.com/tayloraswift/swift-dom) producen HTML muy bien, pero usan una sintaxis diferente para componer elementos HTML.

## Direcciones futuras

- Experimentar con swift embebido para wasm y construir un seguimiento de estado/reconciliador ligero para manipulación reactiva del DOM encima
